result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Rachel L. Mayo in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CF78, 21CF101, 22CF30, 22CF43 and 22CF131. Court notes defendant is trying to obtain a public defender. Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:30 AM Defendant Rachel L. Mayo in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CF78, 21CF101, 22CF30, 22CF43 and 22CF131. State speaks to counsel representation of defendant. Court speaks to public defender contacts. Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:34 AM Defendant Rachel L. Mayo appeared by video, in custody at the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Laurence Moon appears via Zoom. Defense indicates he is withdrawing.  Defendant confirms.  Court grants Attorney Moon's motion to withdraw.  Judge Bloom authorizes judicial transfer back to Vilas County, judicial to complete application. Court sets status of counsel hearing on Sept 9, 2022, at 11:30 am.
Status hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:39 PM Defendant Rachel L. Mayo in court, in custody.  Attorney Laurence M Moon appeared by video for Rachel L. Mayo.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Moon and Defendant to appear in person in Oneida Court, for Pleas and Sentencing Hearing.  Oneida County will prepare orders to transport defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

3:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Karl P Hayes appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rachel L. Mayo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laurence M Moon appeared by video for Rachel L. Mayo. 
Calling 21CF78, 22cf43,21cf101 and 22cf30.
Motion for modification of bond filed in 22cf43- Moon statement to motion.  Court questions Attorney Moon regarding status of cases. Offer just recently made - would like to discuss with client. Court puts parties into breakout room.  Off record 3:22. Back on record 3:27 All parties present. 
Hayes statement to motion to modify/ objects. Court statement.  Court denies motion to modify bond. 
Court will set all cases for further PTC.   If not resolved court will set for trial. 
All bonds continued as currently set.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Moon by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets pre trial for June 9th at 3:00 pm. bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on April 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Rachel L. Mayo appeared by video in the Vilas County Jail. Attorney laurence M moon appeared by video for Rachel L. Mayo.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court. Attorney Moon speaks on bond. Court denies motion to modify bond at this time.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rachel L. Mayo appeared by video in the Vilas County Jail. Attorney Moon appears by video for the Defendant.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Moon waives reading. Court sets Preliminary Hearing for March 25th at 9:00 am. bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Moon by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause for this matter. Court sets $2,500.00 cash bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. Court sets initial appearance for March 23rd at 1:00 pm.
